body.p: However, the boards concluded that if either of the criteria in paragraph 35(c) of IFRS 15 is not met, recognising revenue over time would not faithfully depict the entity’s performance and the entity’s and the customer’s respective rights and obligations in the contract. Furthermore, the boards decided that clarifying the ‘no alternative use and right to payment for performance completed to date’ criterion would ensure greater certainty and consistency in recognising revenue for multi-unit residential real estate developments.
